content:
There is no specific information available about Charles F. Reynolds III, M.D.'s direct contribution to the DSM-5 (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition). The DSM-5 is published by the American Psychiatric Association and is developed through the efforts of many mental health professionals, including researchers, clinicians, and academics.

Dr. Reynolds is a highly respected expert in geriatric psychiatry, with a focus on mood and sleep disorders in older adults. While it's possible that his research and expertise may have influenced the understanding and criteria for diagnosing and treating mood and sleep disorders in geriatric populations, I cannot confirm his direct involvement in the development or revision of the DSM-5.
